metadata.title: CVE-2017-16875 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in Teluu pjproject (pjlib and pjlib-util) in PJSIPbefore 2.7.1. The ioqueue component may issue a double key unregistrationafter an attacker initiates a socket connection with specific settings andsequences. Such double key unregistration will trigger an integer overflow,which may cause ioqueue backends to reject future key registrations.

criterions.comment: pjproject: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
